role: Open Source Developer - OpenMRS, LibreHealth, RTEMS and CCExtractorOpen
description: Google Code-in (GCI) was an international annual programming competition hosted by Google LLC that allowed pre-university students to complete tasks specified by various partnering open source organizations.
tasks: Contributed to OpenMRS, LibreHealth, RTEMS, JBoss/WildFly, and CCExtractor.
Collaborated with a team of student designers to spearhead a new brand and design system for established Open Source Organizations.
Learned invaluable skills ranging from documentation to research, training, design, outreach, quality assurance, and coding by working closely with my mentors.
